required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Fluzoparib and Camrelizumab in Treating Patients With R/M NPC That Progressed After First-line Chemotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Single-site the Study of the Efficacy and Safety of Fluzoparib and Camrelizumab in Treating Patients With Recurrent/Metastatic Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma That Progressed After First-line Chemotherapy

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to define the efficacy and safety of Fluzoparib and Camrelizumab in treating patients with recurrent/metastatic nasopharyngeal carcinoma that progressed after first-line chemotherapy.

detailed_description.textblock: Currently, the standard first-line treatment for recurrent/metastatic nasopharyngeal carcinoma is cisplatin-based chemotherapy. The recommended subsequent line therapy is single-agent chemotherapy or single-agent PD-1 antibody (nivolumab or pembrolizumab), according to NCCN guidelines (head and neck cancer, version 2021.3). However, the efficacy of nivolumab or pembrolizumab in subsequent line setting is limited, range from 20-30%. In order to improve the efficacy, we launch this study to evaluate whether combination treatment of PARP inhibitor (Fluzoparib) and PD-1 antibody (Camrelizumab) has the potential to increase efficacy in the subsequent line treatment, meanwhile has tolerable adverse effect.

primary_outcome.description: Overall response rate, evaluated by independent radiology review board, according to RECIST 1.1 Criteria

secondary_outcome.description: Disease control rate, evaluated by independent radiology review board, according to RECIST 1.1 Criteria
Duration of response, evaluated by independent radiology review board, according to RECIST 1.1 Criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression-free survival rate at 6 month post-treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Progression-free survival rate at 6 month post-treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall survival rate at 6 month post-treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival rate at 6 month post-treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression-free survival rate at 12 month post-treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Progression-free survival rate at 12 month post-treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall survival rate at 12 month post-treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival rate at 12 month post-treatment
Adverse effect, according to CTCAE 4.0.03 criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall response rate by different PD-L1 TPS subgroups
secondary_outcome.description: Overall response rate by different PD-L1 TPS subgroups (≥1% vs. <1%; ≥20% vs. <20%; ≥50% vs. <50%）)

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall response rate by different homologous recombination repair status (HRR)
secondary_outcome.description: Overall response rate by different homologous recombination repair status(germline BRCA mutation/wildtype, HRD positive/negative, germline HRR genes mutations status)

arm_group.description: Fluzoparib,150mg bid po, d1-21, q3w Camrelizumab 200mg iv, d1, q3w

intervention.description: Maintenance therapy of Fluzoparib and Camrelizumab, until disease progression or intolerable adverse effect.

link.description: ASTRO 2020. Oral presentation. Title: Whole-Exome Sequencing Identified Multiple Germline Mutations of DNA Repair Pathway in Patients with and without a Family History of Nasopharyngeal Carcinoma.
